Uses of Package
opennlp.ccg.alignment

Packages that use opennlp.ccg.alignment
opennlp.ccg.alignment This package provides classes for modeling alignments between two phrases. 
opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer Package for the disjunctivizer, which creates a disjunctive LF XML structure based on an LFGraphDifference. 
 

Classes in opennlp.ccg.alignment used by opennlp.ccg.alignment
AbstractEncodingScheme
          Abstract class for implementing encoding schemes.
Alignment
          An alignment consisting of a pair of phrases and a set of mappings between them.
EncodingScheme
          An encoding scheme for mappings.
IndexBase
          A set of Enum constants representing the two common indexing bases used in representing alignments.
Mapping
          A mapping from an index in the A phrase position to an index in the B phrase position.
MappingFormat
          A class for formatting mappings according to an encoding scheme and a specified set of formatting fields.
MappingFormat.Field
          Marks mapping fields like ID, first index, second index, etc.
MappingGroup
          Class for representing groups of mappings during reading or writing.
MappingReader
          Class for reading Mappings from an underlying reader based on a specified MappingFormat.
MappingWriter
          A writer for outputting Mappings to a specified underlying Writer.
Phrase
          A phrase, i.e., a sequence of words with an associated phrase number.
PhrasePosition
          In an alignment, a phrase position indicates which of the two aligned phrases is first (the "A" phrase) and which is second (the "B" phrase) in terms of the alignment indices.
PhraseReader
          A phrase reader just reads line numbers, but does not search for phrase IDs.
PhraseWriter
          A writer for phrases.
Status
          A set of Enum constants for describing the status of a mapping, either as Status.POSSIBLE or Status.SURE.
 

Classes in opennlp.ccg.alignment used by opennlp.ccg.disjunctivizer
Alignment
          An alignment consisting of a pair of phrases and a set of mappings between them.
PhrasePosition
          In an alignment, a phrase position indicates which of the two aligned phrases is first (the "A" phrase) and which is second (the "B" phrase) in terms of the alignment indices.
